alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:55AM CDT until June 08 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL RAY AND WEST CENTRAL LAFAYETTE COUNTIES... At 155 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Wellington, or 7 miles southwest of Lexington, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Wellington and Napoleon. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
